item.description: When you are such a bad cook you burn the ice

item.title: Bubbles are good at math
item.description: In this video I talk about minimal surfaces and how you can do your own experiment to prove if something is a minimal surface. I talk about why minimal surfaces are important in math and physics and show you some neat experiments to make several minimal surfaces at home

item.title: Why is the sky blue?
item.description: In this video I show you why the sky is blue and the sun is yellow. I talk about Rayleigh and Raman scattering and how it changes the colors that we see from the sun.

item.title: Non electric circuits
item.description: How to build a computer without using any electricity

item.title: The sound that keeps rising
item.description: Ever heard a sound that keeps rising but never gets higher?

item.title: 1 big magnet vs. 1,000 small ones
item.description: Is one big magnet stronger than 1,000 small ones?

item.description: I open my vacuum chamber under water to see what it looks like

item.title: The shape that shouldn't exist
item.description: Gömböc the ninja turtles secret weapon

item.title: The coolest way to exit a vehicle
item.description: In this video I show you what it looks like to run and jump off a trailer going the same speed as it moving forward. Will you just stand still on the ground? I also show you what it looks like to jump on a moving vehicle. Do you fall off or stay with it?

item.title: Testing the strength of a spider
item.description: Spiders are stronger than you think!

item.title: Why did my glass melt in the microwave?
item.description: An experiment explains how certain types of glass can heat up and even melt in a microwave, breaking down the physics of microwaves, materials, and energy absorption.

item.title: What if the speed of light was slower?
item.description: In this video I show you what it would look like to slow the speed of light down to around walking speed. So with just walking around town you would experience relativistic effects. I talk about time dilation and length contraction and what it would look like to have it happen to you.
